Posts.Content: jodiel1 wrote: hello i have seen a lot of posts about vitim d.I just wondered what was the correct amount to be taking? i dont think my mums levels have been checked yet, do they always check this? Also has anyone got any advice on foods that are good to try to help reduce the risk of the cancer coming back? I no its a bit of a long shot but im trying to find out anything that might help? x my mum has breast cancer not me x Dx 8/27/2009, IDC, 5cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, 1/11 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Nov 11, 2009 03:33PM - edited Nov 11, 2009 03:33PM by jodiel1 so glad to have found this thread, its so encouraging.I worry about my mum so much, ever since she found out she had breast cancer ive worried that its spread. She`s had 2 ops mx in september and then all her nodes removed end of oct, still waiting for the results to see how many lymph nodes were involved. I agree with many of you that say its horrible when other people say " thank god my nodes weren`t involved". i hoped she would have neg nodes but she`s got 1 out of 2 so far and will find out friday if there was any more. i dread it, its all the waiting around for the next lot of results that drives me mad. i suppose if there are move nodes involved there will be more tests to be done? Its really encouraging to read posts with people going strong years after dx with possitve nodes x
Posts.Title: Stage II w/Lymph Node Involvement Warrior517 Moderators

Posts.Content: Nov 11, 2009 05:09PM jodiel1 wrote: hi, she had mastectomy on one side only. after both ops she had to wait 2 weeks for the pathology. it does seem a long time,but seems to be the average wait in the uk. They have said she will be having chemo,so i suppose that will start soon. It`s such a long jurney isn`t it? x
Posts.Title: Stage II w/Lymph Node Involvement Warrior517 Moderators

Posts.Content: jodiel1 wrote: she had her last chemo last wednesday, she hadnt been feeling too bad until she started getting really low and depressed. she hasnt slept properly the last couple of nights, even though shes just been given stronger sleeping tablets. She got up today and passed out for a bit, the ambulance come and shes in hospital having tests done. has anyone expierenced this before? thanks. my mum has breast cancer not me x Dx 8/27/2009, IDC, 5cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, 1/11 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
